Package ristretto.problem.fs.subset.supervised

Class FSSubsetSupervisedCoevolutionaryProblem

  • java.lang.Object
    • ec.Problem
      • ristretto.problem.fs.subset.FSSubsetProblem
        • ristretto.problem.fs.subset.supervised.FSSubsetSupervisedProblem
          • ristretto.problem.fs.subset.supervised.FSSubsetSupervisedCoevolutionaryProblem
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ec.coevolve.GroupedProblemForm, ec.Prototype, ec.Setup, ec.simple.SimpleProblemForm, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable
    public class FSSubsetSupervisedCoevolutionaryProblem
extends FSSubsetSupervisedProblem
implements ec.coevolve.GroupedProblemForm
    Co-evolutive Lexicographic Multi-objective wrapper for supervised (labeled) datasets solved using a subset of feature indices as individuals representation. The training data is split into two datasets, TR and VAL, according to the validation-prop parameter, and then, some objectives are evaluated, depending on the evaluation-mode parameter. Since the algorithm performs a lexicographic search, the order of objectives matters:

    Evaluation mode Objectives
    validation-only
    1. The Kappa index obtained with VAL (maximized)
    2. The number of features (minimized)
    3. The SVM C parameter (minimized)
    validation-training
    1. The Kappa index obtained with VAL (maximized)
    2. The Kappa index obtained with TR (maximized)
    3. The number of features (minimized)
    4. The SVM C parameter (minimized)
    cross-validation
    1. The Kappa index obtained using cross-validation over the whole training data (maximized)
    2. The number of features (minimized)
    3. The SVM C parameter (minimized)

    Parameters

    base.classifier
    Classifier    		 (the classifier to be used within the wrapper procedure)
    base.apply-lda
    boolean    		 (whether to apply LDA to the selected features before the classifier)
    base.validation-prop
    double > 0, < 1     		(Proportion of samples used for validation)
    base.evaluation-mode
    String: "validation-only", "validation-training" or "cross-validation"    		 (Mode of evaluation for the individuals)
    base.folds
    int: > 1    		 (Number of folds for cross-validation)
    base.set-context
    Boolean    		 (Whether to include the context or not in the co-evaluation)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form
